title: NGC 494
text: NGC 494, also occasionally referred to as <a href="Principal%20Galaxies%20Catalogue">PGC</a> 5035 or <a href="Catalogue%20of%20Nebulae%20and%20Clusters%20of%20Stars">GC</a> 282, is a <a href="barred%20spiral%20galaxy">barred spiral galaxy</a> in the constellation <a href="Pisces%20%28constellation%29">Pisces</a>. It is located approximately 227 million <a href="light-year">light-year</a>s from <a href="Earth">Earth</a> and was discovered on 22 November 1827 by astronomer <a href="John%20Herschel">John Herschel</a>. <a href="John%20Louis%20Emil%20Dreyer">John Dreyer</a>, creator of the <a href="New%20General%20Catalogue">New General Catalogue</a>, described the galaxy as "very faint, pretty large, extended, 3 faint stars to south".
